website_summaries.verdict: If you love Starbucks so much that you don’t care to drink anything else, then look no further – the Verismo is the coffee-maker for you. Coffee drinkers who like fresh ground beans and experimenting with different brands will want to look for a more versatile brewer.
pros: The Starbucks Verismo 580 is easily one of the best-looking single-serve coffee brewers available
The coffee and espresso it brews both taste almost exactly like what you’d get at your neighborhood Starbucks, for a lot less money
cons: With the Verismo, your options are hugely limited – it’s Starbucks, or it’s nothing
The powdered-milk lattes are also terrible

customer_reviews.title: it is a used one, and yes only paid ...
customer_reviews.text: it is a used one, and yes only paid $60 but it leak water from the tank. so I just learn to not fill up the tank too much otherwise it's all over my kitchen counter!
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Leonhart

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, produces a good cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint about this one is I seen them advertised (not from Amazon) for $20 cheaper. Also, you have to use either the Kfree cups or the pods that work in the CBTL coffee makers. Needless to say, the options to get the pods are much less since your vendors are more limited than other 'popular' machines. All and all, it works as advertised and produces a good cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: Verismo.....Bellissimo!!
customer_reviews.text: The Verismo is one of the best all-around coffee machines for the price. With 19 bars of pressure it brews coffee shop quality esspresso shots, latte's, or regular brewed coffee by pressing a button, just like Starbucks. Just press one button and seconds later you have perfect esspresso. Press two buttons and you can make a chai tea latte or regular latte all in under a minute. Just made my favorite - Grande Americano. The Verismo.....Bellissimo!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Robins

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I like my Nespresso Pixie, but the milk frother aerochino is not easy to clean. I found the Verisimo has the milk pod which is very convinient for my latte and cappuchino. The mik pod doesn't taste same as the real milk, but still pretty ok. I found the Verisimo machine is compatible with CBTL capsules and that's a real benefit of this machine. Since I don't like the verisimo coffee pod (they are priced way high) much, I use the verisimo milk pod and CBTL coffee pod on this machine. I love the design of the machine, it is very neat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Best decision EVER
customer_reviews.text: I use is every day. I have one at home and one at the office. Could not be happier. Literally no complaint.
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: The best tasting coffee of the pod coffee makers
customer_reviews.text: Not two day delivery, and first one didn't work...but it was definitely new in box, so not the seller's fault. They immediately sent me a replacement...didn't want the old one back! New one works fine and I prefer the coffee it makes over the other two major pod makers....I own all of them. To be honest both the other pod coffee makers are better made and more thought out. If you forget to put the handle down on this one, it will pump water just fine....all over the counter! The other two are engineered to more idiot proof....they just make as good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: TxAny

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: easy to use like to see more items for the unit besides coffee the water could be a little hotter
customer_reviews.author: dale thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very good cup of coffee. Only issue is that you have to empty the tray to catch the used coffee cups every time you use it or it gets sticky/smelly. I wish it didn't even have a catch tray and made you take the empty carton out when its done like the Keureg Vue does. Otherwise great.
customer_reviews.author: Hanover Laura

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves the machine
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the product, would recommend the machine to all others. She is an avid Starbucks patron and now has the best of both worlds with the Verismo.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Eliason

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO MAKE LATTE
customer_reviews.text: ITLIKE TO ESPRESSO AND THE MILK PODS THAT MAKE ENABLES YOU TO MAKE LATTE EASILY. I THUK I ORFER IT TO THE NESPRESSO WHICH I ALSO HAVE. ONLY PROBLEM IS I WHICH THE HAD SEVERAL DIFFERENT TYPES OF ESPRESSO PADS. HOWEVER,THE MACHINE HAS TO BE RINSED BEFORE EACH USE, AND IF I HAVE USED A MILK POD/LATTE THE THE WATER THAT COMES OUT WHEN RINSING IS VERT MILKY AND I AM NOT SURE WHETHER I NEED TO RUN WATER THRU AGAIN. ALSO, THE MANUAL TALKS ABOUT THE NEED TO USE A SPECIAL DESCALER WHICH CAN BE PURCHASED DIRECTLY FROM VERISIMO ,BUT I HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO FIND THE DESCALER ON THIER WEB SITE.
customer_reviews.author: babydoc

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning and amount
customer_reviews.text: Needs to be cleaned after each use and is a pain. 9 ounces is a weird amount for a cup when we are used to 12.
customer_reviews.author: C Yanagi

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I've lived this long without
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase. I can make a single coffee drink or just make a cup of hot water for my tea. Really like but wish it had a larger cup option. I have to do two of the big cups to equal a regular cup of tea/coffee.
customer_reviews.author: DeenieL

customer_reviews.title: I was fine with it
customer_reviews.text: Once I saw a youtube video showing tricks and tips, I was fine with it......it's also nice to know that you have an alternative choice with regard to pods.....the CBTL pods work just as well as the Starbucks one, at a fraction of the Starbucks cost.....
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Messina

customer_reviews.title: Great espresso and coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: We have had our Verismo for a month now and use it everyday. The coffee and espresso are great. We make a lot of vanilla latte's and mocha's. We used a few of the milk pods but prefer heating regular milk in microwave. Did not care for taste of milk pods. An unused pod will fall through occasionally but is easily retrieved from used pod bin. Overall, the quality of the drinks are excellent and comparable to what you get in the Starbucks store.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Lockridge

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift but enjoyed it with the recipient. Makes a consistently wonderful cup of coffee with ease and consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The machine was loud and leaked water. Returned it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: GLV

customer_reviews.title: gift was loved
customer_reviews.text: the product was exactly as i expected it. it was a gift and they are very pleased with the coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Gina Leto

customer_reviews.title: Little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The coffee is what I expected, but the cup size is small. Other things I would change is the way you have to refill the water and the machine is quite loud.
customer_reviews.author: Barry J. Ludvik

customer_reviews.title: Say NO the the Verismo 580
customer_reviews.text: Machine does not offer the Starbucks experience. Product does not compare to the store by any means. Milk is not frothed.
customer_reviews.author: Karan Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Verismo
customer_reviews.text: It does not work prperly and its a mess to clean up. It is a total waste of money. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: myles

customer_reviews.title: works great I always get delicious foam
customer_reviews.text: This machine is very simple to operate with only 3 buttons, works great I always get delicious foam...
customer_reviews.author: Andres R. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Coffee Lovers
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and extremely convenient. Looks sharp on my counter and great for company as well. I typically purchase the Verismo pods at Bed Bath and Beyond and use the 20% monthly coupon for the best deal on the pods. Hopefully Costco and/or Walmart can start carrying them. Otherwise, Starbucks never fails! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has worked steadily for my office for a over almost a year now
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize I would only be able to use cups directly from Starbucks. They are very small and only makes about half a cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Pickett

customer_reviews.title: It's good.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I got a Keurig to be honest, since they offer more variety, but as an exclusively Starbucks brewer, it does just fine. Easy to use and whatnot.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S.

customer_reviews.title: What a waste
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted this for Christmas and I said, Kerig but she wanted this one. First, I had to order pods on line because one one was carrying the products. Even Starbucks was out which I checked with them many times, they would say, "in the next few days". It doesn't heat the water hot enough so after you make a cup, you have to put it in the micro. I have to run it through a few times because the size light flashes but only lets me brew espresso size cup. So, now it is in her basement because she can't drink coffee anymore-she is pregnant and I can't find tea products. Such a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: DelisJ

customer_reviews.title: Expected more from Starbucks
customer_reviews.text: On occasion it leaks and leaves water underneath it...the milk pod taste is bad, doesn't even come close to taste of cream or milk. It heats the water amazingly fast and the shape is counter friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Hallelulia
customer_reviews.text: I'm so thrilled with this machine. Keeping in my office for those special treats to help me enjoy the day even more.
customer_reviews.author: teacher

customer_reviews.title: Verismo as a gift
customer_reviews.text: The person who received this as a gift really likes it, however I was upset because as soon as I bought it the price dropped $50. I guess it really isn't worth $200.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your very own Starbucks
customer_reviews.text: Starbucks is now in my kitchen. Simple to use and every cup is perfect
customer_reviews.author: SLOJoe

customer_reviews.title: very nice unit. I ended up buy 3 total from ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice unit. I ended up buy 3 total from the seller go give out as holiday presents. shipped on time and no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Chang

customer_reviews.title: Starbuck brewer
customer_reviews.text: I love espresso. Have been trying to get that flavor from my Kuerig for 3 years, but could never find a blend that delivered. Even at a 3 shot/pod level this brewer is great. Starbuck pods are a little expensive for me, but I will pay the price to get the quality. Have to try the brewer pods next. Have only had the unit for a few days. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: jebInman

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee at home
customer_reviews.text: This machine really does deliver good tasting coffee in a matter of minutes. Whether brewed or espresso, you can have real flavor at home. For those of us who live miles away from the nearest Starbucks, this machine is a nice substitute for driving miles to get good coffee on days you otherwise don't have to go into town.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Monroy

customer_reviews.title: completely frustrated with my purchase! I thought I was ...
customer_reviews.text: completely frustrated with my purchase! I thought I was buying a new coffee maker and what I got was something old, worn and full of scratches.
customer_reviews.author: NDG

customer_reviews.title: Don't think. Just buy.
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by the high shipping. This is STILL cheaper than what they sell at Starbucks. I had just planned on getting this to make at home espresso drinks but while moving houses, I discovered that this makes the hands down best regular coffee. Yes. Lil homie puts the Keurig to shame and it pains me to say that. The cups are a bit pricey.. (About $.99 a cup) but daaaaayum. It's worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good. Too bad You can't get the pods
customer_reviews.text: Good. Too bad You can't get the pods A better product than Keurig,yet the SB stores sell the K-cups and not the Verisimo pods. BBY have only two flavors now. Not a great choice of flavors even online, only one Tea. I think SB lost the plot on this product and the whole company did not get behind it. Looks like they have given up. A Pity! Fortunately CBTL pods work well in this machine and there are a lot more to choose from, and they are cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Reid

customer_reviews.title: Leaked
customer_reviews.text: Brand new machine leaked with first use. Noone responded to my e-mail query and customer service said take it back. Now I see others have had this problem. I had already purchased a bunch of pods, but I don't think I am going to get a replacement. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Makes excellent coffee and espresso. The milk pods do taste a little off, but I've found that a latte tastes great if I use around half the steamed milk. Coffee-maker is attractive and fits easily on the counter; easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C.

customer_reviews.title: The coffee it makes is wonderful, but it is limited in versatility
customer_reviews.text: The coffee it makes is wonderful, but it is limited in versatility. One must use only the k-fee pods which are not easy to come by in our area- only found in one store aside from a starbucks.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Dont review the milk pod- its a option
customer_reviews.text: It makes a good shot of espresso and a better and stronger cup of coffee than the Keurig can manage The milk pod is a option for offices that do not have a ready supply of milk next to their coffee machines- I do not prefer the milk pods and use real milk with the milk frother. Why down vote for a additional option? You dont have to use it The espresso is better than the nespresso Pixie and the coffee is better than the keurig (its two closest competitors) and it can make both coffee and espresso. No other machine can do as much with this value price point
customer_reviews.author: coastal

customer_reviews.title: Stick with a Keurig
customer_reviews.text: I got this from my husband for Christmas after having a Keurig for the past 5 years. He knows I love my Starbucks and thought this would be great, but it is definitely not worth the money. Positives: It is compact It is sleek and looks nice on my counter I think the coffee and lattes taste good Negatives: It is very loud, much louder than I ever expected The water container is small The portions are very small (not even a full cup of coffee) It drips a lot after the drink is done If I could return it, I would in a heartbeat and buy another Keurig instead.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha L

customer_reviews.title: Good for hosting.
customer_reviews.text: This machine offers very high quality shots that are just as good as Starbucks. I like it for when we have family events or church events at our house. People ask for what drink they want and can get one in much less time than with a traditional espresso machine. The biggest difference is the quality - espresso shots are always flavorful and the way they are supposed to be. Some espresso machines don't have the BAR pressure to produce a concentrated, quality shot making it like strong coffee (or a watered-down espresso shot). This does the job - and it's always the same product.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: even on espresso setting it was like drinking hot water with literally no fresh coffee taste ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely tasteless coffee...even on espresso setting it was like drinking hot water with literally no fresh coffee taste or smell... we bought this for ourselves for Xmas and back to the store it goes. Do NOT waste your money on this worthless piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Decaf Debacle!
customer_reviews.text: When brewing regular coffee, it works great! For some reason known only to Howard Schultz, the machine spews out decaf coffee grounds around the time it is halfway through the brewing cycle. The end result is a grimy, mini-grounds filled cup of coffee which is virtually worthless no mater how long you stir it. When I inspect the spent pod and compare it to a regular coffee one, there is a second puncture point. Since I am off caffeine per doctor's orders, look for my Verismo in the for sale cheap section.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Cornyn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product but after trying every single pod for it (coffee, espresso, and lattes), i can honestly say they all taste horrible. The worst is the latte because its made from dry milk that smells rancid and tastes just as bad. It's one of those products where you can't help but wonder if they development team even tried it out because everything tastes so bad. It also only makes small servings that are expensive and the machine, despite looking simple, still isn't all that user friendly. Get a different single cup brewer, you'll be glad you didn't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: The Verisimo way out-performs the competition. It leaves Keurigs everywhere in the dust. Want fast, Starbucks quality lattes from your kitchen? Look no further. I was incredibly pleased with mine, having had a Keurig. You will be pleased with yours, too. I know it!
customer_reviews.author: coffeeking

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one use.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after one use. It's possible it got wet at the bottom. I did not immerse it in water as the warning says, however, it seems like if a drop of water touches the bottom of the frother (not the base), it will short out. I returned it and will probably get the more expensive aeroccino by Nespresso. When I returned it, the employee at Bed Bath & Beyond told me that many were returned, and the Verismo machines.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Verismo vs Keurig
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Verismo at Christmas and after 5 months, I'm trading it in for a Keurig. 3 front switches are awkward to work, it's loud and water holder is difficult to refill. Biggest thing is limited to Veranda and Pikes Place coffee. Coffee is good but so is Keurig which is also easier to work and offers all kinds of coffee and tea flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for leaks
customer_reviews.text: Our Vermissmo developed a leak after 35 brews. Seems lots of people had problems with leaks, particularly early buyers. Not sure if they have a fix. Starbucks customer support was abysmal. I finally got them to refund my money but have learned a lesson. I will never buy anything other than coffee at Starbucks.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy and delicious
customer_reviews.text: I just got this as a gift and it's fantastic. So quick and easy to use. You quite simply drop in the pods lower the lever and press a button. And in a few seconds you have a hot freshly brewed cup of coffee, espresso, latte, I've tried all the variations and they are all great. I really like this machine because it lets me make a single serving. My only complaint I have is the cost of the pods themselves. I'm hoping that eventually the price will come down as the machine gains popularity. **side note, a little Hershey's syrup and a milk pod makes a great hot chocolate for the kiddos ***
customer_reviews.author: A. Reckeweg

customer_reviews.title: WEAK, flavorless Lattes
customer_reviews.text: Had a tall latte in a Starbucks store as they were demoing this machine. NOT GOOD. Tastes like weak, off-putting 'milk,' and that's being generous. ZERO COFFEE flavor. And certainly NOTHING like Starbucks. I am SHOCKED Sbux allowed this machine to come to market.
customer_reviews.author: C N

customer_reviews.title: Great espresso machine at a great price
customer_reviews.text: The machine makes a great espresso, coffee tastes better than what comes out of a k-cup as well. I also like the convenience of being able to buy the pods when I'm at my local Starbucks. I'd recommend this machine to anyone who wants and easy way to make a latte or an americano at home.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W Wadel

customer_reviews.title: Makes amazing espresso (I use my own milk)
customer_reviews.text: Easy, fast, great tasting espresso. A classic case of over delivering, way better than I expected. Leave it to Starbucks to wait until they have perfected the process.
customer_reviews.author: Kim M Gavin

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this at all
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this at all. The pods are expensive and hard to find. It does make good coffee but count on spending 15$ for a 12 count box.
customer_reviews.author: Alucard

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: This machine is the worst product--you are better off saving your money and buying a drip coffee maker and a hand held immersion blender. It will foam better than this crappy product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: verismo single serve machine
customer_reviews.text: Excellent machine...really enjoy and look forward to single serve coffee. Easy to clean and operate. It was a great purchase and I would do it again!
customer_reviews.author: Boz

customer_reviews.title: Verismo Really Sucks - Tastes horrible
customer_reviews.text: I have had lots of coffee machines and never had a machine where it would change the taste of the coffee to this extend. I found out that the milk pods are the real source of the bad taste. Also, the machine does not allow you to have a regular size coffee late because the button for medium or large size mug does not turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: It's ok - expensive to use - leaks
customer_reviews.text: Unit was expensive, coffee pods expensive - coffee just ok - I miss our old machine! Pods drop though sometimes, milk leaks out and you need to clean often - overall it's ok. Wild not recommend really after using for 3 months. Lattes are super milky so need to use two espresso pods for coffee flavor That's about it.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: terrible
customer_reviews.text: I love espresso. After years of making espresso out of the trusted bialetti.. thought I'd try something easier. Yuck. Absolutely nasty. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Someperson

customer_reviews.title: Can I say something This machine DO NOT let the ...
customer_reviews.text: Can I say something This machine DO NOT let the hot water What can I do !! Only this buttons Jasher for a long time without interruption
customer_reviews.author: raghadObaid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. Simple and easy to use. Very easy to clean. Makes outstanding espresso shots. No mess and easy to experiment with different styles of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Ringstaff

customer_reviews.title: Too little coffee
customer_reviews.text: Only makes 7oz max coffee cup. And pods are very pricey. Who drinks only 7oz cup of coffee? I would not recommend this coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Leaky mess
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this machine but it is difficult for me to recommend it. It is leaky. Have to clean the cup holder base with paper towel after every serving. It also drips well beyond when the brew is done (for espresso and for coffee) so it makes a mess every time. Also the coffee is decent but not hot enough.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip C

customer_reviews.title: Such an annoying machine!
customer_reviews.text: I have this machine & I hate it! First of all it is impossible to figure out how to use. It took my forever to understand all of the cues to rinse the machine etc. If you don't notice that the water reservoir is out, you ruin your $2 pod, it's so annoying. Anytime my mom or mother-in-law come over to visit, I have to explain how to use the machine several times before they get it, and they are not dumb! Part of the problem is that you just don't ever know what the machine is going to do. Also, the pods are ridiculously expensive for a 6oz cup of coffee! Don't bother with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe Starbucks associated their name with this product. Very messy, design was not thought out. Rushed to market without input from actual users.
customer_reviews.author: Shari D. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste you money
customer_reviews.text: My boss bought one for the office. I would NEVER but one! It is awkward to use, you need to run a rinse cycle every time you use it, the pods are expensive and hard to find and you can only buy pods of Starbucks coffee, which I don't find particularly good to begin with. I have a Keurig at home, which I love. Don't wast your money on this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Stockton

customer_reviews.title: dont
customer_reviews.text: We r taking ours back and it doesn't save money. Buythe keurig! Get the filter to where u can use whatever coffee you Want. And get some expressly starbucks bean. And so it that way. Taste the samnd use warmed up milk ..its not worth the money..kuerig does more..the "pods" takes four to get a brande. Your better off buy the ztadbuck drunk at starbucks..2% milk pods r dehydrated and they sell for 12.99 dont. Last time I checked that's a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Do Yourself a Favor and Buy Something Else
customer_reviews.text: I primarily brew espresso with this machine. A disconcertingly large number of espresso pods burst during the brewing process, spewing grounds into the cup and rendering the coffee undrinkable. I don't have any personal experience with other brands so I can't compare Verismo to other products but, on an objective scale, its performance is unacceptable. I'd also add that Starbucks seems to have basically abandoned support of this machine in favor of Keurig. As a result, it's not easy to find Verismo pods... even at Starbucks stores. All in all, I'd suggest looking elsewhere if you're looking to buy this sort of product.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Colombo

customer_reviews.title: update after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: So, I still like it and use it every day to make lattes (although I NEVER use the milk pods - heat real milk in microwave). I'm sure lots of other people have already discovered this, but I'm kind of slow and just realized that if you puncture the pod twice you get more espresso out of one. So, you puncture it (no water) let it drop through, then put it in again and proceed as usual. And if you squeeze it (with your hand- once I got the machine to squeeze it!) after it's made one cup you get a bunch more more drops of very dark espresso. Makes a difference, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Lahm

customer_reviews.title: Great Brewer
customer_reviews.text: You can buy a large box of pods/milk pods for your Verismo brewer at COSTCO online. I haven't been in Costco recently to see if they have these in the store but here is a link to the website if that helps.. $52.99 After $10 OFF Starbucks® Verismo(tm) Espresso Roast Espresso Pods 72 Pods Starbucks® Verismo(tm) Espresso Roast Espresso Pods 72 Pods Compare product
customer_reviews.author: Vader QA customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: After I bought this machine started thinking the coffee pods were pretty expensive compared to Nespresso machines. So I bought a Nespresso machine to compare, here are my findings; 1.I realize the Starbucks machine coffee cost more because you get twice as much coffee per pod. 2.as a result you get twice as much coffee in your cup as well 3. It's much quieter than the Nespresso machine and holds twice as much water. 4. Starbucks machine cost 25 to 50% less 5. If you run out of coffee you can always run up to your nearest Starbucks they're running a 20% off coffee sale right now. 6. Faster and quieter than a Nespresso
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: WARNING, decaf pods rupture!
customer_reviews.text: I got my Verismo last year for Christmas. The only issue I have is that the decaf pods rupture & empty all of the grinds into my coffee cup when making Americano on this machine. I hope Starbucks will FIX this issue soon. Other than that I've had no issues with the other Starbucks pods. This machine makes a delicious cup of coffee! Much better taste than the Keurig and Flavia machines that I also own.
customer_reviews.author: Vero

customer_reviews.title: Good espresso, expensive pods
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a year and at 4 shots a day I spent close to $1500 in one year. It made great consistent espresso with minimal effort and I loved it. But for $1500 a year it's cheaper to buy a superautomatic espresso maker. So that's exactly what I did. I don't mind paying for the convenience but $1 a pod is a bit too much when a superautomatic espresso machine can pull the same shot at 15cents each. I would have stuck with this machine if the pods were 50cents each.
customer_reviews.author: Edih

customer_reviews.title: Love it...
customer_reviews.text: First, mine is Burgundy body (seems Amazon still don't have that color in their stock) Had it for two days now. Coffee, espresso and brewed both tasted great. Haven't tried their Latte, as I am lactose intolerant, tried my latte on warmed up Soy milk..tasted good!! Works for me, but the pods are bit expensive...quite expensive than keurig or nespresso pods/cups/capsules! Otherwise I am liking it....I will suggest to go for this...especially if you need quick shot of espresso, then this is the one, it can surely deliver the shot in few seconds...others had to wait for 2 to 3 minutes to brew...this takes hardly 15 to 30 seconds to be ready for brew.
customer_reviews.author: PatrickSG

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My kids got me the Verisimo for Christmas. I'm returning it. The lattes taste horrible and that was the real reason I wanted it. I have a Keurig and use that for regular ol' coffee. The pods are much cheaper and the coffee is really good. I don't know if I got a defective machine or what but sometimes only a small amount of either the milk pod or expresso pod comes out. I have spent a fortune on lattes from Starbucks and will continue to do so. They are wonderful. The Verisimo lattes are soooo bad!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce K

customer_reviews.title: Water reservoir access
customer_reviews.text: I just got this as a gift and my 1st impression is "Why did they design it so the water reservoir can only be accessed from the back?" In most kitchens this unit is going to be placed against a wall on the counter which means the entire unit must be pulled away from the wall every time the water needs to be refilled. I have noticed this same design on most coffee makers so it is nothing new. Why can't a designer/buyer understand that it can still be placed at the back if accessible from the sides vs the back. This would be a huge improvement to the design.
customer_reviews.author: Design Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffe machine
customer_reviews.text: Well I have a Kuering which I love but I decided to buy the Verismo 580. I got a great deal. This machine is the best ever. Very easy to use. Makes GREAT tasting Lattes!!!! and it makes a great Starbucks coffee. I buy the Starbucks kups for my Kuering and it is very good but the Verisom makes a much better cup of Starbucks coffee. I Love my Versimo. Don't listen to any negatives about the the taste of the milk pods. They are terriffic!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Louis T. Tammaro

customer_reviews.title: Bitter tasting, messy, pods expensive
customer_reviews.text: It's rather bitter tasting and the machine drips for a while after the cup is filled. Also, it's slow and sputters coming out and you have to run a cycle clean each time before use. I bought it for the lattes but it turns out that the milk pods are powdered milk and the lattes taste terrible. The pods are expensive as well and can only be purchased online or in a Starbucks store, not at the supermarket. It can't compete with the Keurig, that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually like it better than vanilla lattes at Starbucks
customer_reviews.text: Not a coffee aficionado just a pick me up in the morning. I thought it would be nice to have coffee in the morning if I am in a rush and I found this to be fast and easy to use. Also, the latte is a little less bitter than the latte at Starbucks. Works well with no problems after having it for a couple of months now.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy into this. It's a terrible machine. The pods are not common use format and are expensive. Not to mention, they make mediocre coffee. The machine requires a lot of maintenance. I think my primary irritation, it doesn't even make a whole cup of coffee per pod. Rather a half cup. This is an expensive and awful machine. No wonder they needed to tie into an expensive and awful coffee brand like Starbucks to sell it. I got mine as a gift, so unfortunately I can't return the sucker. Maybe I'll donate it to my local college and some hipster can enjoy it. For me, I'll go back to using my French Press.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel England

customer_reviews.title: No choice if you want Verona Starbucks coffee
customer_reviews.text: Expected Starbucks to have a decent product, its not. 1. Buy at Bed, Bath and Beyond with 20% off coupon 2. The water bucket in back is a drag. At least let us slip it on, but no.... 3. Put a towel underneath, it leaks lots of coffee into both catch alls. 4. Why does it force you to push the first button before the others? Dumb 5. Can't turn it off, it does it on its own 6. Wide, bigger mugs fit but not so well. 7. NOISY!
customer_reviews.author: Mozartmama

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a couple days ago and am taking it back today! It is such a waste of money. Regardless of what they "claim" it is not like the real thing - AND makes the smallest portions ever! I measured it 5 or 6 times and the expresso shots are LESS THAN 1/2 oz. It takes 4 or 5 pods to make a latte! Do the math, and it not only does not work out, but is also a pain in the butt to have to use that may pods per drink
customer_reviews.author: Veronica W.

customer_reviews.title: cheaper at bed bath and beyond
customer_reviews.text: you can save ALOT getting this at BBB its on sale there right now I got it as a gift so I am not sure how it tastes but I think the pods are waaay to expensive and now 2nd guessing the purchase since its for a student
customer_reviews.author: p113

customer_reviews.title: wah wah wah call ath wahmbulance
customer_reviews.text: Over priced, frustrating to use, it forces you to clean it, the milk is powdered and tastes that way, crappy brew of expensive Starbucks pods. I hate it! I hate it! I hate it! I kept it for a week but...I still hate it! Old school espresso is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jblove

product_meta.title: Starbucks Verismo 580 Brewer Champagne (011023258)
product_meta.description: The Verismo Brewer model 580 - Our lattes. Our espresso. Our brewed coffee. Your home. This single-cup brewing system lets you use specially packaged pods to recreate the Starbucks recipes we use every day in our coffeehouses. With its 1-liter water tank and storage for up to 10 used pods, it’s easy to make plenty of your favorite drinks at home. Enjoy everything from caffè lattes and espresso to brewed coffee. You can also use our all natural milk pods for a rich, creamy hot cup of steamed milk. High-pressure brewing system heats up and is ready to make Starbucks-quality beverages in less than 15 seconds. Variable temperature system allows for optimum coffee extraction and milk steaming. Integrated rinse function helps keep machine clean. Height-adjustable drip tray accommodates different sized cups. Auto-off activates after 5 minutes to save energy. Easily removable water tank makes refilling simple. Built-in used pod removal automatically moves up to 10 pods to storage for easy cleanup.
feature_bullets: Make some of your favorite Starbucks coffee and espresso beverages at home. All from one machine.
Specially engineered pods keep the Starbucks brewed coffee, espresso or milk freshly packed until the moment you use them.
High-pressure brewing system heats up and is ready to make Starbucks-quality beverages in less than 15 seconds.
Integrated rinse function helps keep machine clean.
Coffee cup depicted not included with purchase.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars149 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
